article: Do you still remember your fist day of preschool? Mine was _ . I was about four year old and my mom was helping me get read for school. At that time, I lived in Chicago and it got pretty _ , so I had to wear a big coat. The school wasn't very _ , so my mom and I walked to school. Upon arriving at the headmaster's office, we checked in. I was too nervous to _ myself. Mom talked with the headmaster. Then he gave her the sign that it was time for her to _ . She said goodbye and I started to _ . My mom promised me things would be _ and told me she had to go. I walked with the headmaster to my _ . The whole time I was thinking why this was happing to me. When we arrived, the headmaster _ me to my preschool teacher, but I just wanted to go home. My teacher told me to have a seat with the other _ . I sat next to a girl named Jasmine. She asked me my _ and I told her I was called Will. She asked me _ I was crying. I said, "I didn't want to be here." I guess she saw some leftover _ on my face from earlier. I felt nervous again. I wanted to go _ because I felt sick and wanted to throw up. But just before I _ my hand, it happened. I felt so _ . All the children shouted and I was frozen with _ . I thought Jasmine would be disgusted with my action, but she said: "That's OK I still _ you." I knew from then on Jasmine and I would be good _ .
